event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: There are communication failures on an i2c bus to an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates that there has been a failure of a I2C bus, or a device on that bus, in the External I/O Expansion Unit. The inaccessible device and all the suspected bus segments in the FRU are called out. Errors are only generated if the attempted device access fails. There could be devices that are affected but wont' be diagnosed until access is attempted by software.

The i2c bus may span multiple FRUs and may be caused by failed components or possibly by a bent pin. If any FRU's have been recently replaced make note of it when opening the Service ticket. There are 3 I2C buses which result in a single FRU call out: i2c_c bus on the centerplane, and i2c_local on the link cards

Follow the steps below to obtain the necessary data for presentation to your authorized service provider.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

XSCF> fmdump -m
   MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8000-CQ, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 05:31:20 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 95e12e0b-10f9-480c-bd6f-216c60ffc1c3
   DESC: There are communication failures on an i2c bus to an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/IOXSCF-8000-CQ for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken
   IMPACT: External I/O Expansion Unit FRUS may no longer be monitored. They
   may not be discovered at the next reboot.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.

Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -v -u 95e12e0b-10f9-480c-bd6f-216c60ffc1c3
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 05:31:20.1213 95e12e0b-10f9-480c-bd6f-216c60ffc1c3 IOXSCF-8000-CQ
       50% fault.chassis.iox.i2c.bus
       Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/i2c_c=0
          Affects: -
              FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=XCX031:part=5016937:revision=03/component=IOX@X031
       50% fault.chassis.iox.i2c.device
       Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/ledctrl=0
          Affects: -
              FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=XCX031:part=5016937:revision=03/component=IOX@X031

Step 3: Collect other output
Use the 'showlogs error' command to determine if there are any other errors in the system. 

   XSCF> showlogs error

You may also wish to run the ioxadm command to list existing FRU's. 

   XSCF> ioxadm list

Step 4: Provide the output collected to your service provider.
The information collected above will help your service provider to schedule a repair at your convenience.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: External I/O Expansion Unit FRUS may no longer be monitored. They may not be discovered at the next reboot.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: External I/O Expansion Unit i2c communication failure
